Posts.Content: I had a core biopsy 1 week ago. Turned out to be PASH. The breast is sore - sort of a light burn and tender. I don't think there is a hematoma as all I feel is the PASH lump (I think). For those who have had a core biopsy, did you have pain a week later? I am icing and talking Tylenol. Thanks for any help. There isn't a site like this that is active for PASH, so I am checking any breasts sites I can find.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Thanks. I was warned about
 hematoma, so I will give it a few more days before I call. The way the Dr talked, I figured this was like an injection - needles went in and out, all set to go. It didn't bother me much the first 2 days when I didn't do anything. The I started moving stuff around the house, lifting, etc. perhaps too soon. Bra shopping tomorrow!
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia (PASH) - it can be an incidental finding in other rumors, or be its own tumor (that is my situation). It is a well defined rubbery nodule. 
Biopsy sight and other areas radiating from it hurt a week out. Not MAJOR pain, but uncomfortable.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I wish I had been given a bit more info. Like, wearing a sports bra will REALLY help - I didn't wear one at all over the weekend, because the surface of my skin is bugging me. I ended up at GP today because breast clinic is closed and I have a red, warm spot that burns a bit to touch under the needle poke area. She just said to call if it gets bigger and then I can have meds...
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy
